frameDefinitions: A Customer requests an Entity from a Supplier.

An individual that is scheduled to be a Participant, or already is a Participant in an Activity or an Organization, indicates that  they will no not or no longer participate in that Activity or Organization.
In this frame, a Booker brings about a situation where an Organization plans to provide Services to a Client at a particular Scheduled_time.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.
These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
frameExamples: I <t>ordered</t> a black scarf from J. Crew a week ago.
The Moslem contingent had <t>withdrawn</t> from the EC talks on May 27.
We can <t>book</t> you a boatride on the Somme or a special tour of the Louvre .
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
Abby bought a car from Robin for $5,000.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Customer</fen> is the person or business ordering the <fen>Entity</fen> from the <fen>Supplier</fen>.
The object ordered by the <fen>Customer</fen>.
The person or organization from whom the <fen>Customer</fen> orders the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Customer</fen> requested the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The individual or individuals that are engaged or are scheduled to be engaged in an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The event that the Participant is engaged in or was scheduled to be engaged in.
The <fen>Organization</fen> is an intentionally formed human social group with some definite structure to which the <fen>Participant</fen> belongs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Participant ends their participation in the Activity.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Participant ends the participation in the Activity.
The entity that is intended to receive the <fen>Services</fen> of the <fen>Organization</fen>.
The goods or labor that the <fen>Client</fen> requests the <fen>Organization</fen> preserve for future consumption or rendering.
The entity that enters into its records the request of the <fen>Client</fen> to retain <fen>Services</fen> in the future.
The future point in time when the <fen>Client</fen> arranges for the <fen>Organization</fen> to provide <fen>Services</fen>.
The entity that contacts the <fen>Organization</fen> directly.  In many if not most cases, a <fen>Booker</fen> is also a <fen>Client</fen>, but the roles may also be separated, e.g. a travel agent.
The time at which the reserving event takes place.
The location the <fen>Booker</fen> performs the action.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Simone</fex> ordered a hamburger and fries.
Liz ordered <fex>a new espresso maker</fex> for the office.
Mrs. Apfelbaum ordered a coffee <fex>from the barista</fex>.
Sara placed the order <fex>three days ago</fex>.
Instead, <fex>he</fex> was challenged by Neil Gaudry, and withdrew from the race when it appeared that he would not be victorious.
In any event , in mid-April he withdrew <fex>from the contest</fex>.
This led to the decision to withdraw <fex>from IMF agreements</fex> in May 1987 .
Phil Collins booked his <fex>cockatoo</fex> into a $350-a-night pet hotel.
She reserved the room for the meeting <fex>for Tuesday</fex> .
The hotel reserved two rooms for me .
I booked the room for Monday <fex>only on Tuesday</fex> .
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
They arrested Harry <fex>for shoplifting</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
<fex>Jess</fex> bought a coat.
Only one winner purchased <fex>the paintings</fex>
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
